title: Heron's Formula
description: Area = √(s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)) where s is the semi-perimeter. Computes triangle area from side lengths alone.

meta.author: Hero of Alexandria (formalized in Lean 4 with Mathlib)

overview.historicalContext: Hero of Alexandria described this in 'Metrica' (~60 AD). Practical for surveying without measuring angles.
overview.proofStrategy: Derive from the Law of Cosines and the area formula Area = ½ab·sin(C).

conclusion.summary: Heron's formula is verified using Mathlib's Euclidean geometry library.
